comment.author: 31575009@N05
comment._content: From Duncan Richardson via email: In the lower photo of a street in Georgetown 1902 you will note a carved wooden figure of woman tied to the corner of the building on the left side of the street. My research has led me to believe that it is the carved figurehead of the British sailing ship Loanda that was wrecked on the Georgetown shore during the great hurricane of 1898. The wreck of the ship was exposed by the sea some 10 years ago and recently I was sent a photo of a painting of the ship clearly showing the same figurehead. See my article www.caribbeancompass.com/online/aprilcompass_online.pdf (page 19).
